results.title: Children's language in early reading (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Open University and Edward Milner
results.brief_description: Samples some of the early reading activities in two primary schools in Britain. These activities include use of word cards, sentence construction and reading of printed texts and children’s own stories.

results.title: Children's fantasies
results.brief_description: To children all fantasies, useful or destructive, are very real. This film explains some of the causes of children’s fantasies and shows how they may affect a child’s development. It discusses such common problems as fear of the dark, imaginary friends, and the interpretation of Santa Claus. Suggests ways of making fantasies an impetus to creative living rather than an escape from reality.

results.title: Children's aggression: its origin and control (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines the basis for normal aggression in young children, and presents methods for effectively managing this behaviour. Laboratory demonstrations and filmed examples of children’s aggression illustrate its types and causes

results.title: Childhood: the enchanted years
results.brief_description: An introduction to the study of the physical and mental development of the child from birth to four years of age is presented in this film. Shows how children learn to reach, perceive, walk and talk. Of particular interest are the simple perceptual experiments which show the reactions of the psychological mechanisms of the child.

results.title: Childhood sexual abuse: four case studies
results.creator_credit: Cavalcade Productions, MTI Teleprograms and Dale McCulley
results.brief_description: In a weekend workshop setting, four women relive their experiences of early sexual molestation. Each of the women reveals a uniquely poignant story.

results.title: Childhood aggression: a social learning approach to family therapy (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: PRB Productions, Oregan Research Institute, Phillip R. Blake and Steven D McAdam
results.brief_description: This film documents Tim’s aggressive behaviour, how it makes the family miserable and hinders Tim at school. Once the need for help has been established, the family contact the Oregan Research Institute Family Centre and move through the treatment process. The widespread changes occurring within the family as treatment progresses is shown.

results.title: Child survival alliance
results.brief_description: Looks at Colombia’s massive attempt to immunize all its children. Three days a year are set aside by the government to give the children vaccines against polio, diptheria, whooping cough, tetanus and measles.

results.title: Child psychiatry: autism's lonely children
results.creator_credit: National Educational Television, David Prowitt, Philip Burton and Jack Willis
results.brief_description: Explains the work of Dr. Frank Hewett in teaching autistic children to talk and identify objects. Shows work with a child and Dr. Hewett attempting to transfer to the child’s parents techniques used successfully to evoke responses. Discusses the possible effectiveness of the approach on other autistic children.
